title: DirectSell.AI marketing landing page with “How it works” guidance

requirements.text: Create a responsive landing page for “DirectSell.AI” that clearly explains the product and who it is for (helping users reach potential customers using AI), using English for all user-facing copy.

quotes: create a landing page for DirectSell.AI and users how to use the AI to help them to reach the potential customers

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the app shows a single landing page (no placeholder/template content).
All headings, body text, buttons, and labels are written in English.
Layout is responsive and readable on mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Include a top navigation and hero section with: product name (DirectSell.AI), a one-sentence value proposition, and at least one primary call-to-action button (e.g., “Get Started” / “See How It Works”).

quotes: create a landing page for DirectSell.AI

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section includes DirectSell.AI name, a short value proposition, and a primary CTA button.
Top navigation includes links that scroll to page sections (e.g., How It Works, Features, FAQ).
CTA button scrolls to or focuses the “How It Works” section (or equivalent) on click.

requirements.text: Add a “How it works” section that teaches users how to use DirectSell.AI to reach potential customers. Present as a clear step-by-step flow (3–6 steps) with short descriptions and example prompts/messages.

quotes: users how to use the AI to help them to reach the potential customers

acceptanceCriteria: Section is explicitly titled (e.g., “How it works”).
Includes a numbered step flow with concise descriptions.
Includes at least 3 example prompts/messages a user could copy and adapt.
Examples are written in English and are relevant to customer outreach.

requirements.text: Add supporting sections that reinforce the product story: (a) Key benefits/features (3–6 items), (b) Use cases (at least 3 audience scenarios), (c) FAQ (at least 4 questions), and (d) Footer with basic links (e.g., Privacy, Terms placeholders) and a short tagline.
acceptanceCriteria: Features/benefits section lists 3–6 items with short explanatory text.
Use-cases section includes at least 3 distinct scenarios for reaching potential customers.
FAQ contains at least 4 Q&A items and is readable/scannable.
Footer is present and includes at least two placeholder links (Privacy/Terms) and a short tagline.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme for the landing page (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) with a distinct style appropriate for an AI sales/outreach product; enforce it consistently across all sections (avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors).
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent color palette and typography scale are used across the page.
Buttons, cards, and section headers share consistent styling.
Primary brand colors are not predominantly blue/purple.

requirements.text: Add generated static brand visuals to the landing page by placing them in frontend/public/assets/generated and using them in the hero and/or navigation (do not serve images from the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Landing page references these images via static paths.
No backend code is added to fetch/serve these assets.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Do not modify files listed as immutable: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Keep the app as a single-page marketing landing experience (no requirement for authentication).
nonGoals: Building a dashboard or multi-page onboarding wizard.
Integrating third-party CRM/email tools or external APIs.

required: DirectSell.AI wordmark logo, modern minimal typography on transparent background (directsellai-wordmark.dim_1200x300.png)
Abstract AI + outreach hero illustration with warm, modern palette, no text (directsellai-hero-illustration.dim_1600x900.png)
